panels.name: Scope
panels.markdownSource:
### $__scope

- It is a scope variable in a PromQL dashboard that helps user to apply dashboard scope to the PromQL queries easily.
- So a query previously defined as

      avg(ads_brand_rtb_hb_bidresponse_count{environment=~$env,gameid=~$gameID,DSPID=~$dspID,seatID=~$seatID,medServer=~$mediation,deploy=~$deploy})

Can be simplified to

           avg(ads_brand_rtb_hb_bidresponse_count{$__scope})

- Please note that $__scope will pass the entirety of your dashboard scope to the metric, so it doesn't fit use cases where you want to use dashboard scope selectively.

- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/release-notes/enhanced-metric-store/#scope-variable-in-promql-dashboard

panels.name: Snap to the nearest TS & Contextual Tooltip
panels.markdownSource:
### Snap to the nearest TS & Contextual Tooltip

- Hover Over anywhere in the timeseries panel and Sysdig will snap it to the nearest TS.
- Sysdig displays all the segments as contextual tooltip to help you fitler TS easily.

**More Info -**
https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/release-notes/saas-sysdig-monitor-release-notes/#contextual-tooltip

panels.name: Snap to the nearest TS & Contextual Tooltip
New Panel
panels.markdownSource:
### Stacked Area and Stacked Bar

- It is a way to visualize the data in Timeseries Panel.
- Stacked Area or Stacked Bar helps to visualize how each metric or category contributes to the cumulative total.
  - ⭐️**Tip:** **Use Stacked Bar to visualize sparse data 
- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/visualisation-types/timechart/

panels.name: PromQL in Table & Toplist Panel
panels.markdownSource:
### PromQL in Table & Toplist Panel

- Sysdig supports PromQL in table and toplist panels. 
- It includes all PromQL Operators, Functions, etc.

- **More Info -** 
  - table - https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/visualisation-types/table/#view-resource-utilization-of-your-kubernetes-workload-using-a-promql-table-panel
  - toplist - https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/visualisation-types/toplist/

panels.name: Sparse Data using Stacked Area or Stacked Bar
Sparse Data (Not using Stacked Area or Stacked Bar)
$__interval_sec & $__range_sec
panels.markdownSource:
### $__interval_sec & $__range_sec
$__interval_sec
- Same as $__interval but this variable will be replaced with an absolute value in seconds
- useful to use as rate for gauge metric type

$__range_sec
- Same as $__range but this variable will be replaced with an absolute value in seconds
- useful to use as rate for gauge metric type

- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/using-promql/#built-in-variables

panels.name: Lazy loading
panels.markdownSource:
### Lazy loading

- Lazy loading greatly reduces the initial page loading time by only loading panels once they become visible on screen.

**More Info -**
https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/release-notes/saas-sysdig-monitor-release-notes/#lazy-loading-of-dashboard-panels

panels.name: Confirm Navigation
panels.markdownSource:
### Confirm Navigation

- If user hits “Esc” key while editing the dashboard panel, Dashboard panel used to come out of the edit mode and users lost all their changes
- Now, Sysdig will pop up a confirmation message if there are unsaved changes and User is trying to come out of the edit mode

panels.name: Dynamic Links in Table Panel
panels.markdownSource:
### Dynamic Links in Table Panel

- The PromQL panel supports the configuration of dynamic links. 
- You can generate an external or internal URL using the label values returned by the PromQL query
- You can have multiple dynamic links on one table panel

- **More Info -** 
https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/visualisation-types/table/#using-links

panels.name: Dashboard Manager
panels.markdownSource:
### Dashboard Manager
Dashboard Manager acts as the central repository for all your dashboards. You can use the Dashboard Manager for the following:

- View all the dashboards that you have created, marked as favorite, and that your teams have shared with you.
- Access the list of Dashboards from the Library available to you.
- Create and Manage existing Dashboards.
- Perform bulk operations on Dashboards

- **More Info -** 
https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/dashboards/dashboard-manager/

panels.name: Translate Form-Query to PromQL
panels.markdownSource:
### Translate Form-Query to PromQL

- With a single click, you can translate form query to PromQL, and build PromQL-based dashboards in no time
- Available in Timechart, number & Toplist

- **More Info -** 
https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/release-notes/saas-sysdig-monitor-release-notes/#translate-form-query-to-promql

panels.name: Enhanced Label Selector
panels.markdownSource:
### Enhanced Label Selector
The label selector in Dashboards and Metrics Explorer has been enriched with 
- Preview of label values
- Label documentation (Only for K8s Labels enriched by our Sysdig Agent)
- Suggested labels

panels.name: Enhanced Alert Editor
panels.markdownSource:
### Enhanced Alert Editor
- Sysdig introduces a new Alert Editor with an improved user experience thanks to a redesigned look and feel.
- We’ve also added the ability to link a dashboard and a runbook to the alert definition to expedite troubleshooting.

- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/release-notes/saas-sysdig-monitor-release-notes/#enhanced-alerts-editor
- https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/alerts/configure-alerts/

panels.name: Alert Group as Dropdown
panels.markdownSource:
### Alert Group as Dropdown
- Allows users to select group name instead of typing.
- Only for Metric Alerts for now. Coming soon for PromQL Alerts
- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/sysdig-monitor/alerts/configure-alerts/

panels.name: Configurable Slack Notification Sections
panels.markdownSource:
### Configurable Slack Notification Sections

- You can customize the sections that will be included in the messages sent to each configured Slack channel
- Configurable per Channel (not per Alert)
- If you need different customization for the same Slack channel, create two different Slack channels.
- **More Info -** https://docs.sysdig.com/en/docs/administration/administration-settings/notifications-management/set-up-notification-channels/slack-notifications/#customize-notifications
